metadata.title: CVE-2018-1092 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The ext4_iget function in fs/ext4/inode.c in the Linux kernel through4.15.15 mishandles the case of a root directory with a zero i_links_count,which allows attackers to cause a denial of service(ext4_process_freed_data NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via a craftedext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-snapdragon - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1012-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1012.13
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1010-aws - 4.15.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1009-gcp - 4.15.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1011-kvm - 4.15.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1008-oem - 4.15.0-1008.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-23.25').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1012.13').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1010.10').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1009.9').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1011.11').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.11').
